title: traces
description: JSON schema for BigQuery table traces

transaction_hash.description: Transaction hash where this trace was in

transaction_index.description: Integer of the transactions index position in the block

from_address.description: Address of the sender, null when trace_type is genesis or reward

to_address.description: Address of the receiver if trace_type is call, address of new contract or null if trace_type is create, beneficiary address if trace_type is suicide, miner address if trace_type is reward, shareholder address if trace_type is genesis, WithdrawDAO address if trace_type is daofork

input.description: The data sent along with the message call

output.description: The output of the message call, bytecode of contract when trace_type is create

trace_type.description: One of call, create, suicide, reward, genesis, daofork

call_type.description: One of call, callcode, delegatecall, staticcall

gas.description: Gas provided with the message call

gas_used.description: Gas used by the message call

trace_address.description: Comma separated list of trace address in call tree

error.description: Error if message call failed. This field doesn't contain top-level trace errors.

status.description: Either 1 (success) or 0 (failure, due to any operation that can cause the call itself or any top-level call to revert)

block_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the block where this trace was in

block_number.description: Block number where this trace was in

block_hash.description: Hash of the block where this trace was in

trace_id.description: Unique string that identifies the trace. For transaction-scoped traces it is {trace_type}_{transaction_hash}_{trace_address}. For block-scoped traces it is {trace_type}_{block_number}_{index_within_block}
